definitions: A Soviet politician and cultural ideologist.
A city in Ukraine, formerly known as Mariupol, renamed Zhdanov from 1948 to 1989 in honor of Andrei Zhdanov.
examples: Andrei Zhdanov was a key figure in Soviet cultural policy.
The city of Zhdanov was a major port on the Sea of Azov.
Zhdanovism refers to the cultural doctrine promoted by Zhdanov.
